results.title: Introduction :: Red Planet Labs
results.summary: Rama is a new programming platform that enhances application development through a distributed-first paradigm, allowing developers to focus on logic rather than low-level hurdles. This documentation provides insights into mastering Rama and its programming model, which emphasizes scalability and fault-tolerance.

results.title: Operating Rama Clusters
results.summary: This page details the setup and management of Rama clusters, providing essential information for evolving application features and performance needs over time.

results.title: Operating Rama clusters
results.summary: This page covers everything you need to know to set up Rama clusters and manage module deployments. It provides mechanisms to manage the evolution of modules in a robust and easy-to-use way.

results.title: Download
results.summary: This page provides instructions for downloading various versions of the Rama software, including links to one-click deploy options for AWS and Azure. It also includes detailed release notes for each version.

results.title: Setting Up a Rama Cluster
results.summary: This documentation page outlines the steps required to deploy a Rama cluster, including prerequisites and configuration options for optimal performance.

results.title: Introducing Spin | Spin Docs
results.summary: Spin is a framework for building and running event-driven microservice applications using WebAssembly components. It is open source and designed for portability and fast performance, making it suitable for various deployment environments.

results.title: Quick Start | Spin Docs
results.summary: The Quick Start guide provides a fast track to getting started with Spin, offering essential steps and resources for new users to build their first applications quickly.

results.title: Writing Spin Applications | Spin Docs
results.summary: This section of the documentation explains how to write applications using Spin, detailing the necessary components and best practices for effective development.

results.title: Built With Spin | Spin Docs
results.summary: Explore various applications and projects that have been developed using Spin, showcasing the framework's versatility and capabilities in real-world scenarios.

results.title: Contributing to Spin | Spin Docs
results.summary: This document provides guidance for making contributions to the Spin project, welcoming various types of contributions from the community.

results.title: Developer Community Calls
results.summary: Join the Spin Project Meetings held every Monday to discuss issues, roadmap, and ideas, open to anyone interested in contributing.

results.title: Code of Conduct
results.summary: All contributions to the Spin project must adhere to the established code of conduct, promoting an inclusive community.

results.title: Making Code Contributions to Spin
results.summary: This section outlines the steps to ensure your code contributions to Spin are successful, including prerequisites and setup.

results.title: Before You Commit
results.summary: Guidelines to follow before committing changes to ensure code quality and compliance with project standards.

results.title: Committing and Pushing Your Changes
results.summary: Instructions on how to properly commit and push changes to the Spin project, including signing commits and following conventions.

results.title: Publishing and Distribution | Spin Docs
results.summary: This page provides comprehensive guidance on how to publish and distribute Spin applications using container registries. It covers logging into registries, publishing applications, running them, and signing applications for verification.

results.title: Logging Into a Registry
results.summary: This section explains the process of logging into a container registry, including methods for using tokens and fallback credentials for authentication.

results.title: Publishing a Spin Application to a Registry
results.summary: Learn how to publish a Spin application to a registry using the `spin registry push` command, including the format for references and visibility settings.

results.title: Running Published Applications
results.summary: This section details how to run published applications from a registry, including commands for running by digest and pulling applications.

results.title: Signing Spin Applications and Verifying Signatures
results.summary: Explore how to sign and verify Spin applications using tools like Cosign, ensuring the integrity and authenticity of your applications.
